p: Tyrosinase is a key enzyme which involved the catalysis of the only rate-limiting step in mammalian melanogenesis, so tyrosinase inhibitors are used to treat hyperpigmentation in the human skin [ 40, 41]. As shown in Table 3, EO showed a weak inhibitory effect on tyrosinase (IC 50 = 53.71 Â± 4.89 mg/mL).
